about.short: Quant-Grade is an internal trading engine and analytics platform that performs multi-timeframe technical and quantitative analysis on Indian equities and crypto, generating clean, rule-based signals, risk levels, and optional automation hooks for execution.
about.long:
Quant-Grade was built to bring structure and discipline to active trading in both Indian markets and crypto. Instead of relying on scattered indicators and discretionary decisions, the project focuses on rule-based, multi-timeframe analysis that can be executed consistently.

The system ingests price and market data for selected instruments, runs quant and technical models across multiple timeframes (1m, 15m, 1h, 2h, 4h, 1D, 1W), and outputs directional bias, key levels, and trade hypotheses. These are surfaced via a web dashboard and can be connected to broker APIs for semi-automated or fully automated strategies.

Quant-Grade is designed as a modular engine: the core does data ingestion, feature engineering, and signal generation, while the UI, alerting, and execution layers sit on top. This separation makes it easier to test new strategies, plug in AI models for regime detection, and eventually expose the platform as a SaaS for traders and small trading desks.

roles_and_responsibilities: Defined the overall product vision: one engine covering both Indian equities and crypto, with multi-timeframe analysis and strict risk controls.
Designed the trading system architecture: data layer, signal engine, risk module, backtesting layer, and execution adapters.
Implemented the backend services in Python (data ingestion, feature pipelines, and strategy runners).
Designed and implemented the web dashboard for watchlists, multi-timeframe views, and signal summaries.
Integrated alert mechanisms (email, Telegram/WhatsApp-ready messages) for live or near-real-time notifications.
Planned a toggleable architecture to switch between paper trading, simulation, and live trading modes.
objectives: Build a robust, reusable engine for quantitative & technical analysis across multiple timeframes.
Support both Indian equities/derivatives and crypto assets under a single platform.
Remove emotional decision-making by enforcing rule-based entries, exits, and position sizing.
Create a dashboard that explains signals clearly, so traders understand the 'why' behind trades.
Prepare the system for future SaaS or white-label deployment to prop desks and advisors.

core_engine: Data ingestion for Indian equities/indices and crypto pairs from supported brokers/exchanges.
Indicator and feature pipeline (trend, momentum, volatility, volume-based signals).
Signal engine producing directional bias (long/short/neutral) and confidence scores.
Rule-based trade setup generation with entry, stop-loss, and take-profit levels.
ai_and_quant_layer: Model-driven scoring of instruments to shortlist best candidates per session.
Regime awareness (trending vs ranging, high-vol vs low-vol environments).
Multi-timeframe alignment logic (e.g., trades only when at least 3–4 timeframes agree).
dashboard: Watchlist of instruments with real-time or near-real-time status.
Per-instrument detail view with OHLC chart and signal overlays by timeframe.
Signal summary section showing aligned timeframes, bias, and suggested trade direction.
Risk-reward view with suggested position size and risk per trade (configurable).
Session view (today/this week) listing the best-rated opportunities.
risk_management: Configurable max risk per trade and per day.
Soft and hard daily loss limits; when breached, new trades are blocked or restricted.
Simulation/paper trading mode for safe testing of new strategies.
automation_and_alerts: Paper trading execution engine to test strategies without real money.
Broker/exchange adapters (conceptual integration with Indian brokers like Zerodha/Fyers/Upstox and crypto exchanges like CoinDCX/Binance).
Alerting via email/push/Telegram-style messages containing trade plan and key levels.
End-of-day and end-of-week recaps summarizing performance and notable setups.
admin_and_config: Strategy configuration panel (enable/disable modules, tweak parameters).
Environment toggles: backtest, paper, live (with different API keys and risk controls).

backend: Python for core engine, data ingestion, and feature pipelines.
FastAPI / Django REST Framework for APIs.
Celery / background workers for scheduled jobs (data updates, signal generation).
Task queues for strategy runs and broker API calls.
quant_and_data: Pluggable AI/ML models via scikit-learn / compatible frameworks for scoring and classification.
frontend: React / Next.js dashboard for real-time-ish views.
Reusable chart components for OHLC, indicators, and signal overlays.
Responsive design for desktop-first use with tablet support.
database_and_storage: PostgreSQL for user & configuration data, signals, and trade logs.
Time-series storage pattern for price and signal history.
Redis for caching latest signals and current watchlist snapshots.
integrations: Broker APIs (planned: NSE/BSE brokers like Zerodha/Fyers/Upstox).
Crypto exchanges (planned: CoinDCX/Binance style API integration).
Email/notification provider for alerts and summaries.
hosting_devops: Dockerized services for engine, API, and dashboard.
Deployed on VPS / cloud provider with environment separation (dev/stage/prod).
Basic CI/CD pipeline for pushing engine and dashboard updates.

research_and_design.summary: Studied trader workflows, defined system architecture, selected indicators and risk models, and outlined initial strategies.

engine_v1.summary: Implemented data ingestion, feature calculations, and base signal engine with backtesting hooks.

dashboard_v1.summary: Built web dashboard for watchlists, signal views, and configured basic notification system.

internal_launch.summary: Started using the system in internal simulated and light live environments to validate signals and UX.

ongoing_rnd.summary: Continuous tuning of strategies, models, and risk parameters, with a path toward a SaaS-ready offering.

budget.notes: Budget is expressed as equivalent effort/value for a full commercial build including research, engine development, dashboard, and infrastructure. As an internal R&D product, actual cash outlay is primarily time and infrastructure costs.

challenges: Need to support both Indian equities and crypto under a consistent architecture and UI.
Designing a system that is powerful for advanced traders but still readable for semi-beginners.
Managing data quality and API reliability across multiple exchanges and brokers.
Avoiding overfitting and indicator overload by focusing on robust, testable strategies.
Implementing strict risk controls to prevent emotional or over-leveraged trading.
solutions: Separated the engine into clear layers: data, features, signals, risk, and execution, so each part can evolve independently.
Focused dashboard design on a small set of interpretable metrics: direction, confidence, levels, and risk, instead of cluttering with dozens of indicators.
Introduced environment modes (backtest, paper, live) so changes can be validated safely before live deployment.
Built a configuration system to toggle strategies and parameters without changing core code, enabling faster experimentation.
Embedded risk rules (max daily loss, max risk per trade) directly into the engine, so trades are automatically blocked when limits are hit.

qualitative: Created a reusable quant engine that can be applied to both Indian and crypto markets.
Standardized how instruments are evaluated, scored, and shortlisted, reducing noise and randomness.
Enabled systematic tracking of strategies and performance rather than relying on ad-hoc trades.
Prepared a strong technical and product base for a future retail/SaaS offering under the Quant-Grade brand.
outcomes.example_metrics_note: As an internal R&D system, metrics are focused on stability, backtest coverage, and consistency of signals rather than public performance claims. Live performance numbers can be added later once fully validated.
